thread.title: What’s for tea at Ebernoe Cricket Club?
thread.title_full: What’s for tea at Ebernoe Cricket Club? - Telegraph

author: The Telegraph
title: What’s for tea at Ebernoe Cricket Club?
text: Read more about the Great Cricket Tea Challenge The spit-roasted lamb was painstakingly overseen – and basted for five hours – by Bruce Whittington at the Sheep Roast End while the first innings took place. The potatoes, greens – runner beans and peas – and carrots were prepared by Ebernoe’s tea lady, Jean Stemp, who happens to be an expert on the history of the club and its Horn Fair. Jean also produced three wonderful desserts – banoffee pie, meringue pie and apple pie. All utterly delicious. Jean doubles up as captain of the brilliant refreshments marquee, which is available to players and their families. It offers an array of food: ploughman’s lunches, delicious traditional sandwiches and a generous spread of homemade cakes from many of the villagers – scones, rock cakes and Victoria sponges. “We are very lucky to have Jean. We are completely spoilt by her cooking and commitment,” said Richard Stemp, Ebernoe captain – and son of Jean. What's for tea at other finalists' grounds? What’s for tea at Bishop Thornton Cricket Club? What’s for tea at Uffington Cricket Club? What’s for tea at Newtown Linford Cricket Club?
